meanings.definition: A person engaged in an activity on a part-time basis for pay.
meanings.sent1: The semiprofessionals at the event helped with organizing and setting up.
meanings.sent2: Many semiprofessionals work as tutors in the evenings to earn extra money.
meanings.sent3: The group of semiprofessionals tried to juggle their part-time jobs with their studies.
meanings.sent4: In the world of sports, they are the semiprofessionals who play for the love of the game.
meanings.sent5: The semiprofessionals in the theater group brought enthusiasm and dedication to their roles.

meanings.definition: A person who is not fully professional but has some professional skills or training.
meanings.sent1: She hired semiprofessionals to help renovate her kitchen due to their expertise.
meanings.sent2: The company often hires semiprofessionals to assist with technical projects.
meanings.sent3: The team of semiprofessionals impressed everyone with their knowledge and abilities.
meanings.sent4: He was considered a semiprofessional in photography, capturing stunning images.
meanings.sent5: The semiprofessionals in the workshop shared their skills and learned from each other.
